meanings.definition: Opposition to the theory of evolution.
meanings.sent1: Her antievolutionism was evident in her refusal to accept any scientific evidence supporting evolution.
meanings.sent2: The antievolutionism of the group led to heated debates in the science class.
meanings.sent3: The antievolutionism of the cat was clear when it refused to believe in the theory of evolution.
meanings.sent4: His antievolutionism was like a wall blocking any discussions about the topic.
meanings.sent5: The antievolutionism in the room was palpable, with everyone holding firm to their beliefs.

meanings.definition: The belief or movement that rejects the concept of evolution.
meanings.sent1: Their antievolutionism was so strong that they formed a group to protest against the teaching of evolution in schools.
meanings.sent2: The rise of antievolutionism in the community caused a divide among the residents.
meanings.sent3: The antievolutionism of the squirrel was comical as it tried to argue against the concept of evolution.
meanings.sent4: In a sea of ideas, his antievolutionism stood out like a bright red flag.
meanings.sent5: The intensity of her antievolutionism could be felt in every conversation she had about evolution.

meanings.definition: A stance against the acceptance of evolutionary principles.
meanings.sent1: His antievolutionism was so strong that he refused to even consider the possibility of evolution.
meanings.sent2: The antievolutionism of the group was based on their religious beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The antievolutionism of the penguin was amusing as it tried to argue against the concept of evolution with its waddling.
meanings.sent4: Her antievolutionism was like a shield protecting her from any discussions about evolution.
meanings.sent5: The room was filled with tension due to the strong antievolutionism of the attendees.
